Plays > The Gion Festival

The Gion Festival

(祇園祭礼信仰記) (Gion sairei shinkōki)

Written By: Nakamura Akei (中邑阿契) , Toyotake Ōritsu (豊竹応律) , Asada Icchō (浅田一鳥) , Koku Zōsu (黒蔵主) , Mitsu

First Staged: 1757

Reference: Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 203, May 1982; Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku May 1982 Performance Program

Kashira:

Musume (娘)

Genta (源太)

Baba (婆)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Kintoki (金時)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Koyaku (子役)

Keisei (傾城)

Wakaotoko (若男)

Sanmaime (kani) (三枚目（かに）)

Jiji (sewa) (爺（世話）)

Oniwaka (鬼若)

Kodanshichi (小団七)

Kiichi (鬼一)

Hagataki (端敵)

Otoko koyaku (男子役)

Takeuji (武氏)

Kani (かに)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Sanmaime (三枚目)

Hayaku (端役)

Performances:

May 1971: The Gion Festival

April 1981: The Gion Festival

May 1982: The Gion Festival

January 1990: The Gion Festival

May 1995: The Gion Festival

April 1996: The Gion Festival

Scenes:

The Strands of Love (道行恋の小田巻)

Imoyama and Seyama Mansions (妹山背山)

The Well-Cleaning (井戸替)

The Improvised Bamboo Hearse (笹引)

The Matsuemon's House (松右衛門内)

The Toothbrush Maker's House (楊枝屋)

The Inn at Otsu (大津宿屋)

Characters:

Shinsaku (新作)

Otsuyu (娘お露)

Mokuzo (Kizo) (どすの木蔵)

Tsubute-no-san (礫の三)

Kanta (勘太)

Teruwaka (輝若君)

Jiju (乳人侍従)

Osaji (母お匕)

Gumpei, in fact Masakiyo (十河軍平実は加藤正清)

Zesai (小西是斎)

Mochibei (庄屋持兵衛)

Tokichi, later known as Hisayoshi (此下東吉後に真柴久吉)

Kojibei (小次兵衛)

Daizen (松永大膳)

Kitota (松永鬼藤太)

Yukihime (雪姫)

Naonobu (狩野之介直信)

Keijuin (慶寿院)

Shingo Ishihara (石原新五)

Tanzo Inui (乾丹蔵)

Chuji Kawashima (川嶋忠治)

Yoshiteru (足利義輝)

Masayasu (三好存保)

Hanatachibana (傾城花橘)

Farmer (下向の衆)
